page.title: 03Farms-size and buildings
page.content: In this farming area there were about 10 farms.The smallest was 120 hectares & the biggest 320.These were well above the national average of 60 hectares. In this landscape farms range in height from 148m in Churn Valley up to 250m at plateau level.One farmer was renting out his grazing land.Older farm buildings were of limestone which came from the local disused quarrys.Newer buildings were usually barns & places to store tractors,combines etc.New buildings are made of materials like concrete blocks,sheet steel, corrigated iron & some may have timber cladding on the outside to enhance the appearance.Several farms have grain silos.Lots of places are used to keep cows in the winter & to protect & store machinery.Some farms were very long established.One farmhouse was 750 years old.
